parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
And he, she, it, and that. From kai and ekeinos; likewise that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To wound in the head. From the same as kephalaion; to strike on the head.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To disgrace, treat disgracefully, dishonor, insult; I despise. From atimos; to render infamous, i.e. contemn or maltreat.
